item.title: Black Ops 7's Endgame Will Soon Be Playable For Everyone Right Away
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Treyarch has announced that Call of Duty: Black Ops 7's Endgame mode, which players can unlock after completing the campaign, will soon be available to everyone.

Beginning Friday, November 21, everyone can jump right into Endgame. Technically you could already do this, as only one player in a group needed to beat the campaign to get into Endgame, but soon everyone can play it.

For anyone just catching up, Endgame takes place on the Avalon map where 1-32 players in squads of up to four fight through zones of increasing difficulty. Players enter Avalon in a wingsuit and can then get through the map on foot or in a number of different vehicles as they complete missions.

For anyone who has completed the campaign, Treyarch is giving them a variety of bonuses, including double XP tokens and Perkaholic Gobblegums. You can see a rundown of all the bonuses below.

We've seen an awesome response to Endgame from players who've already been dropping in, so we're making it available to everyone in #BlackOps7 starting Friday, Nov. 21.

Team up with other players to complete objectives, increase your power, earn unique Weapon Camos, and take on… pic.twitter.com/2igahTPHv6

— Treyarch (@Treyarch) November 19, 2025

In other Call of Duty news, Treyarch is launching the Nuketown 2025 map on November 20. The game is currently in pre-season, with Season 1 set to begin in early December.

For more, check out GameSpot's Black Ops 7 review. You can also catch up on why one US lawmaker is calling for AI regulations after it came to light that Black Ops 7 developers used AI.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Black Ops 7's Nuketown 2025 Map Goes Live Tomorrow, See It In Action Now
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Once again, Activision has reimagined one of Call of Duty's most iconic maps, Nuketown, and it's launching on November 20 for Black Ops 7. Now, Activision has released a new trailer dedicated to the map, which shows off its new look.

The new version is called Nuketown 2025, and as you can see in the trailer, the map appears to be based on the same Nuketown 2025 from Black Ops 2. This makes sense as Black Ops 7 is a sequel to Black Ops 2. Whereas the original version of Nuketown from 2010's Black Ops was based on a '50s theme, this newest iteration has a "retro-futuristic" vibe that imagines what people thought the "neighborhood of the future" could look like.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 - Nuketown 2025 Gameplay Trailer

A key gameplay difference for Nuketown 2025 in Black Ops 7 is that the game features wall-jumping, which affords players new ways to get around the map. Nuketown is a small-size map known for its fast and frenetic action, and with wall-jumping now in play, things might get even more hectic.

Nuketown has seen a number of updates and revisions over the years. Black Ops 6 also brought back Nuketown and offered multiple variations of it, including "Boo-town" for Halloween and a trippy "Blaze Town" makeover for 4/20.

In other Call of Duty news, Treyarch has announced that Black Ops 7's Endgame will be available to everyone starting November 21. Currently, players have to complete the campaign to unlock it.

Black Ops 7 launched on November 14, and, in a break from tradition, Activision's first-weekend social media post about the game did not include any mention of how the game is performing compared to past releases.

For more, check out GameSpot's Black Ops 7 review. You can also catch up on why one US lawmaker is calling for AI regulations after it came to light that Black Ops 7 developers used AI.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Leaked Underwear Homer Would Be First Fortnite Skin With Nipples
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fortnite's Simpsons season is apparently about to become a landmark for Epic Games' metaverse for reasons nobody could have expected--by reportedly offering the first shirtless character sporting visible nipples. The skin in question is an additional version of Homer Simpson, separate from the one in the battle pass, who's wearing nothing but his tighty whities.

The discussion about Fortnite skins lacking nipples goes back to 2019, when a gigantic, shirtless and nipple-less digital version of Travis Scott performed a concert in Battle Royale. Since then we've gotten plenty of other shirtless guys as skins--but none have had nipples. It's not really that hard to figure out why that's been the norm, though, since Fortnite's art style is not realistic or detailed enough for nipples to be anything other than weird. But with Homer, who's cel-shaded and not very detailed, they can draw a couple circles on his chest that don't look upsetting the way that more detailed nipples on, say, the Mr. Savage skin probably would.

Meanwhile, Homer in his underwear is a topic because this week's update added some loading screens, like the one above, that indicate pretty clearly we'll be facing off against a Giant Homer before the season ends--likely controlled by a player, similar to the Megazord and Godzilla events earlier this year. That this Giant Homer will also be a skin sold in the item shop is just a rumor for the moment, and it's possible that the model that has been datamined is merely the giant one that will roam the Battle Royale island.

But the leaker who broke this one, Dr Cacahuette, claims it has associated accessories, a Lego style, and support for kicks, all of which point to it being a player skin. It's possible it will be free, like the cel-shaded Juice WRLD skin was before the end of Remix season a year ago, but since Epic is already giving away the Cuddle Team Rider skin in a separate event, Underwear Homer is likely to be in the item shop.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: TGA Performer, Fortnite Gamer D4vd Reportedly Identified As Murder Suspect
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

By on November 19, 2025 at 10:27AM PST

David Anthony Burke, who began his music career as D4vd after uploading Fortnite montages to YouTube with his own original songs in 2021, has reportedly been identified as a suspect in the murder of Celeste Rivas.

According to TMZ, law enforcement said that despite there being no official paperwork classifying Burke as a suspect yet, "investigators are looking at [him] as a suspect." Those same investigators reportedly claimed they're viewing Rivas' death as a homicide while waiting on toxicology results from the medical examiner's office.

An NBC Los Angeles report corroborates TMZ, stating that an LAPD officer with direct knowledge of the investigation said Burke has been uncooperative with the investigation and that he likely had help with dismembering and disposing of Rivas' body this past spring. According to law enforcement, who spoke to NBC News, Rivas' remains were not intact when discovered.

Sources told ABC News that, although the investigation is ongoing and no arrests have been made, investigators have contacted multiple people they believe were involved with the case in some way. This includes Burke.

Celeste Rivas disappeared in the Lake Elsinore area last year. She was reportedly last seen on April 5, 2024, in the western Riverside County community in Southern California. Family members said she knew Burke, and her brother, Matthew, told NBCLA that she was on her way to see a movie with him the day she disappeared.

Rivas' body was found in the front trunk of a Tesla parked in an LA tow yard on September 8. Workers noticed a foul odor coming from the vehicle, which was registered to Burke, and notified nearby authorities. Officers came through and discovered the remains in a bag, later to be identified via forensics as the missing teenager.

Burke was a rising star in the alternative R&B scene, but he started as a gamer. He uploaded various Fortnite montages and anime compilations to YouTube under a channel called "ant" in 2021, but his videos kept getting copyright strikes because of his music choices. To combat this, he started creating his own songs to pair with his videos, which eventually led to his D4vd persona, which he claimed in a Zach Sang Show interview was both for SEO and the four cinematic universes (and the characters) he was building.

He quickly found popularity on TikTok and eventually signed a record deal with Interscope Records' Darkroom label. He'd then produce a single for Arcane Season 2, record the official Fortnite anthem "Locked & Loaded," perform at The Game Awards in December 2024, and go on a world tour in August 2025. The remaining tour dates have been canceled following Rivas' death.

According to ABC News, investigators believe that the medical examiner's office will determine the official cause of death soon. Sources said this will be a vital step in making an arrest and finalizing the charges.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
